content:
I'll definitely try to incorporate those tips into my improv practice. It's interesting that you mentioned playing listening games, like "Yes, And..." and "Freeze". I actually played some similar games during the improv workshop I attended on April 10th, and it was a lot of fun.

Speaking of which, I was thinking of exploring more improv opportunities in my area. Do you know of any resources or websites that can help me find local improv groups, classes, or workshops?
